SEARCH
Package inventorymanagement

Class Inventory

java.lang.Object
inventorymanagement.Inventory
Direct Known Subclasses:
Part, Product
public class Inventory extends Object
This class provides a list of all parts and products that will be created and modified in the application.

      public Inventory()

  • Method Details

    • addPart

      public static void addPart(Part newPart)
      This method adds a Part object to the allParts list. The Part object in the parameter is added to the allParts list.
      Parameters:
      newPart - This is the part that will be added to the allParts list.

    • addProduct

      public static void addProduct(Product newProduct)
      This method adds a Product object to the allProcuts list. The Product object in the parameter is added to the allProducts list.
      Parameters:
      newProduct - this is the part that will be added to the allProducts list.

    • lookupPart

      public static Part lookupPart(int partId)
      This method looks up a part using the part ID. This method iterates through the allParts list and searches for a part that has an ID with the same value as the parameter.
      Parameters:
      partId - This is the value of the part ID this method is searching for.
      Returns:
      Returns a Part object from the allParts list that has an ID value that is the same as the parameter.

    • lookupProduct

      public static Product lookupProduct(int productId)
      This method looks up a product using the product ID. This method iterates through the allProducts list and searches for a product that has an ID with the same value as the parameter.
      Parameters:
      productId - This is the value of the product ID this method is searching for.
      Returns:
      Returns a Product object from the allProducts list that has an ID value that is the same as the parameter.

    • lookupPart

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Part> lookupPart(String partName)
      This method looks up a part using the full or partial part name. This method iterates through all parts in the allParts list and then returns a list of parts with names that match or partially match the parameter.
      Parameters:
      partName - This is the full or partial name of a part that the method is searching for.
      Returns:
      Returns a list of parts that matches the full or partial name in the parameter.

    • lookupProduct

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Product> lookupProduct(String productName)
      This method looks up a product using the full or partial name. This method iterates through all products in the allProducts list and then returns a list of products with names that match or partially match the parameter.
      Parameters:
      productName - This is the full or partial name of a product the method is searching for.
      Returns:
      Returns a list of products that matches the full or partial name is the parameter.

    • updatePart

      public static void updatePart(int index, Part selectedPart)
      This method updates a Part object in the allParts list. This method updates a Part object that has the index from the parameter in the allParts list with the Part object in the parameter.
      Parameters:
      index - This is the index of the Part object in the allParts list that is being updated.
      selectedPart - This is the new Part object that is updating the old Part object.

    • updateProduct

      public static void updateProduct(int index, Product newProduct)
      This method updates a Product object in the allProducts list. This method updates a Product object that has the index from the parameter in the allProducts list with the Product object in the parameter.
      Parameters:
      index - This is the index of the Product object in the allProducts list that is being updated.
      newProduct - This is the new Product object that is updating the old Product object.

    • deletePart

      public static boolean deletePart(Part selectedPart)
      This method deletes a part from the allParts list. This method removes the Part object in the parameter from the allParts list
      Parameters:
      selectedPart - This is the part being deleted.
      Returns:
      Returns boolean value that is true when the Part object is deleted successfully.

    • deleteProduct

      public static boolean deleteProduct(Product selectedProduct)
      This method deletes a product from the allProducts list. This method removes the Product object in the parameter from the allProducts list. The product cannot be deleted if the product has associated parts. RUNTIME ERROR The first if-else branch was put in to provide extra protection from the product being deleted if it had any associated parts. The if code block had a return statement that was missing a return value which is the wrong return type for the method which caused the error. The problem was fixed by adding an if-else branch that validates if a product has associated parts with out needing a return statement.
      Parameters:
      selectedProduct - This is the Product object being deleted.
      Returns:
      Returns boolean value that is true when the Product object is deleted successfully.

    • getAllParts

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Part> getAllParts()
      This method gets the list named allParts list.
      Returns:
      Returns the allParts list.

    • getAllProducts

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Product> getAllProducts()
      This method gets the list named allProducts.
      Returns:
      Returns the allProducts list
